channel.title: Comments on: Salted Caramel Mochi Donuts (AIP/Paleo)

item.title: By: Annette Rewa
item.dc:creator: Annette Rewa
item.description: This is a great baseline recipe that is very versatile. I use just a regular egg and I have used this to recipe to make several versions. I have made vanilla, chocolate/coconut, blueberry and lemon. I make more of a muffin version instead of a donut but I have made both. All the flavors are a hit and it seems that I am making a different flavor every night. The mochi comes out so good that a glaze is not necessary. In fact I omit the glaze all together. This recipe is a keeper, I have already saved it. Thanks for finding a paleo version. My family loves it.

item.title: By: Rachael
item.dc:creator: Rachael
item.description: These donuts are delicious! I love the chewy texture. They are so much like mochi donuts. I have been on AIP for almost a year now and this absolutely satisfied a craving. I have successfully reintroduced eggs and used one medium egg in this recipe in place of the gelatin egg and it worked out nicely. Thank you for a great recipe!
